result.execSummary:
The defendant Sabrina L. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sabrina L. Thomas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sabrina L. Thomas was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 21CM1611.
Credit to be determined.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
**  Pay restitution in the sum of $27,060.00 plus surcharges.
**  Added the 5% restitution surcharge now.
  May not have contact with victim - gas station, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Take medicine as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sabrina L. Thomas

for Restitution stipulated to by the defendant and to be released forthwith.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Johnson.   Clerk HMcBride.   State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 3 years with conditions concurrent to 21CM1611; credit to be determined;   DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge  - notice give to DE in court.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Johnson by zoom. Clerk HMcBride.  No objection to zoom appearances today.   State is compliant with victim rights notification.  On state's motion, cts 2, 3, 4, 5 are dismissed.   DE enters guilty plea to ct 1.  Court finds DE guilty of ct 1.  State requests PSI.  Atty Johnson objects to an adjmt to prep PSI  - would like court to use the 2021 PSI in file 19CF914.   19CF914 PSI not reviewed by state or court yet. Adjmt granted.   SEH 8/1 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
and Elements

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Johnson.   Clerk HMcBride.  Continued negotiations. Adjmt granted. FPT 7/20 3pm.   Bond continued.

Defendant Sabrina L. Thomas appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Johnson.   Clerk HMcBride.  Report received and reviewed. Stip to findings in report.  Court finds DE competent to proceed.  PH 3/23 1030am.   DE requests bond mod - to be addressed at hearing before Intake Ct.   Bond continued.
and Comp Report
